p: Hematologic malignancies (HM) are a leading cause of morbidity, co-morbidity, mortality, and disability in both rich and resource-poor countries such as Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) [ 1, 5, 7â€“ 12]. The incidence of HM is associated with aging, exposure to pollution (in residence or in workplace) and endemic infections (HIV and other viruses) [ 13, 14]. There is no comprehensive hypothesis regarding the manner in which these risk factors act.
